A thin disk of mass m and radius r is sliding at velocity \(v_o\) and rotating with angular velocity \(\omega_o\) as shown. It strikes and sticks to the edge of a uniform disk of mass M and radius R that is free to rotate about its center axle. The large disk is initially at rest. If R = 3r and M = 2m, find the final angular velocity of the big disk. Express your answer in terms of r, b, \(v_o\) and \(\omega_o\). Type wo for \(\omega_o \) and vo for \(v_o\).
